channel.title: Portal 2
channel.description:
Portal 2 draws from the award-winning formula of innovative gameplay, story, and music that earned the original Portal over 70 industry accolades and created a cult following.
The single-player portion of Portal 2 introduces a cast of dynamic new characters, a host of fresh puzzle elements, and a much larger set of devious test chambers. Players will explore never-before-seen areas of the Aperture Science Labs and be reunited with GLaDOS, the occasionally murderous computer companion who guided them through the original game.
The game’s two-player cooperative mode features its own entirely separate campaign with a unique story, test chambers, and two new player characters. This new mode forces players to reconsider everything they thought they knew about portals. Success will require them to not just act cooperatively, but to think cooperatively.
http://steamcommunity.com/games/portal2
Who bought it or is going to buy it?

item.title: Portal 2
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I was thoroughly satisfied by the single player campaign, if Valve had released just that for Portal 2 I would’ve been happy

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

zachera:

Wait, are there even timed/portal-count chambers in Portal 2 (similar to Portal)?

nope, you only have the single player campaign and co-op campaign, no advanced or speed run chambers

I’m really excited though, I have a feeling valve will end up releasing dozens of free maps like tf2(since they added a mini-transaction fucking store) and there will be thousands of player made maps

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

tL:

Wheatley is Stephen Merchant. Ricky Gervais’s partner in so many things, he co-wrote the office, is on The Ricky Gervais show and is an actor and writer on Extras.

sorry my wording was bad, I can’t stand ricky gervais and it didn’t help that stephen merchant sounded really similar to ricky when playing wheatley, I’m just complaining for the sake of complaining really

[quote=“goatee, post:16, topic:391583”][quote author=Niall link=topic=488744.msg3575498#msg3575498 date=1303392674]
The whole game was 12~ hours
[/quote]

Really? Most people are saying its 6-7 hours long.[/quote]

the single player is around 6 hours long, but there’s also co-op which is more than just a few extra levels so I have no problem with saying the game is around 12 hours long

I really hope more levels are released for free like with TF2, I mean they also copied the in game store in TF2

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Steven Merchant was so beautiful in this, he knew what the game was about and he had fun with it. In between the podcasts and audiobooks and now this game, I think I’ve heard his voice almost every day for the past 6 months or so. Am I a stalker?

On the other hand, an amazingly well polished game that was a joy to play through, although I have yet to venture into co-op mode.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

im posting so late cause i havent checked mitb since portal 2 launched… fucking amazing game. loved every minute of it

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It was such a brilliant game. Played through the ending a few times, played the co-op for six and a half hours straight last night, really enjoyed that too. I didn’t think they would be able to pull off the same level of originality, but they did, and they did it better. Had me chuckling and smiling all the way through, I can’t think of another game that has done that.

Stephen Merchant was fantastic, surprisingly so, I mean, he is an actor (as well as a comedic writer) so it shouldn’t be a surprise that he understood the role so much, but as his first video game character, it couldn’t have gone any better.

Read full topic
